faq.q1: What percentage of AI-generated citations are fake?
faq.a1: Studies show that 15-30% of citations generated by AI language models like ChatGPT are completely fabricated. Another 20-30% may contain errors such as wrong page numbers or publication dates.
faq.a2: SwanRef checks each citation against multiple academic databases including CrossRef (150M+ papers), Google Scholar, and direct publisher databases. We use pattern matching to identify common AI hallucination signatures.
faq.a3: Yes, SwanRef is completely free for academic use. No registration required, no hidden fees, no usage limits. We believe academic integrity tools should be accessible to all students and researchers.
faq.q4: Can I verify citations in languages other than English?
faq.a4: Currently, SwanRef primarily supports English-language citations. However, our interface is available in 8 languages, and we're working on expanding citation verification to other languages.

warning.title: ⚠️ Academic Integrity Warning
warning.desc: Using unverified AI-generated citations can lead to academic misconduct charges, paper rejection, and damage to your academic reputation.
